alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Cherokee; Nacogdoches (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 27 at 11:02AM CDT until May 02 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Angelina River Near Alto affecting Angelina, Cherokee and Nacogdoches Counties. For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Angelina River Near Alto. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding of the river bottom. Ranchers that have cattle and equipment near the river should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 29.3 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1115 AM CDT.
